(1) Added Internal Control so that IRM 2.4 will meet standardize format requirements for all IRMs.
LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I.
Table of Contents
Code TMSSN

) Command Code TMSSN assigns a temporary Internal Revenue Service Number (IRSN) for a taxpayer when their Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number Scope and is unidentiﬁable. The temporary IRSN is used until the taxpayer permanent is identiﬁed. (
) Purpose: This transmits revised IRM
, IDRS Terminal Input, Code TMSSN. (
) Audience: All IRS business units. (
) Program Owner: Customer Service. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Wage and Investment (W&I). (
) Program Goals: This system allows users to continue to work on a account until taxpayer’s account is identiﬁable. (

) A temporary IRSN is assigned upon receipt of taxpayer correspondence tax forms and/or payments) when after an exhaustive research to identify Code TMSSN payer’s TIN and it has been determined that no identifying TIN cannot be Information found. (
) Not to be used for correspondence without a TIN. (

) A temporary IRSN may be assigned for one of the following reasons: • A payment being processed by another IRS system where an has not been provided. • A scrambled condition (same TIN is issued to the taxpayer by the Security Adminstration). • A balance due return for a taxpayer who failed to provide a TIN on document. • A TIN has been previously used and the individual in question is not taxpayer of record. • A taxpayer request for an ITIN was rejected or incomplete. (
) The taxpayer’s entity information is entered into the IDRS system via the TMSSN screen, which creates a new account on the IDRS database and issues a unique IRSN. (
) The new account is stored on the Master File database. (
) The user has the option of generating a C-Letter to the taxpayer informing them of their assigned IRSN. (
) These are the abbreviations unique to TMSSN. Unique to

A scrambled condition (same TIN is issued to the taxpayer by Security Adminstration).
A balance due return for a taxpayer who failed to provide a TIN document.
A TIN has been previously used and the individual in question is taxpayer of record.

A taxpayer request for an ITIN was rejected or incomplete. The taxpayer’s entity information is entered into the IDRS system via TMSSN screen, which creates a new account on the IDRS database issues a unique IRSN. The new account is stored on the Master File database. The user has the option of generating a C
Letter to the taxpayer them of their assigned IRSN. These are the abbreviations unique to TMSSN.

A payment being processed by another IRS system where an identiﬁer has not been provided. A scrambled condition (same TIN is issued to the taxpayer by the Security Adminstration). A balance due return for a taxpayer who failed to provide a TIN on the document. A TIN has been previously used and the individual in question is not taxpayer of record. A taxpayer request for an ITIN was rejected or incomplete.

) TC
— IMF and BMF: A TC
is generated to update the Master File the new account. (
) Quality Review— All transactions are subject to two day Quality Review. (
) C-Letters— A
C,
SP,
C or
SP letter will be generated for entity unless suppressed at the time of input. C-Letters are generated via LETER at the user’s discretion. (
) Sequence Number— The sequence number, which was inserted into the cycle ﬁeld of the IDRS record at the time TMSSN was input, is changed to actual input cycle. (

) NSF— A record will be generated to update the Name Search Facility database with address information for immediate update. When real time update is unsuccessful an indicator will be set to signal batch update is required. (

) During Real Time the following functions are performed. a. An IRSN is generated from the TMP-SSN Assignment Control File, is part of the Centralized Real Time Combined Area (CRTC). b. Validity checks are performed to ensure that data is as accurate as possible. c. The taxpayer’s entity information is recorded on the Name Search (NSF) and either the Individual Master File (IMF) or Business Master (BMF). d. A record is sent through End of Day (EOD) processing to update the propriate Master File. (

) Following are the various TMSSN command code deﬁners and their tions. a. Input individual taxpayer information on the formatted screen using TMSSNI. b. Input business taxpayer information on the formatted screen using TMSSNB.
(01-01-2012) Records Produced During Real Time
(01-01-2011) TMSSN Real Time Overview
a. An IRSN is generated from the TMP

SSN Assignment Control File, which is part of the Centralized Real Time Combined Area (CRTC). b. Validity checks are performed to ensure that data is as accurate as possible. c. The taxpayer’s entity information is recorded on the Name Search Facility (NSF) and either the Individual Master File (IMF) or Business Master File (BMF). d. A record is sent through End of Day (EOD) processing to update the ap
propriate Master File. Following are the various TMSSN command code deﬁners and their descrip
Code TMSSN
) The TMSSN command code is used to input taxpayer information. (
) A temporary SSN will be validated using the National Account Proﬁle(NAP) Code TMSSN ensure that it does not already exist on the Master File. Process a. The ﬁrst digit of an IRSN is always
b. The fourth and ﬁfth digits of an IRSN represent the campus the is coming from or designation unique to IRSN processing. (

) Validation checks are performed to assure that the input data is as accurate possible. If invalid conditions are present the input data will be re-displayed and errors identiﬁed with an asterisk next to them. When all ﬁelds are deter- mined to be valid, an IRSN will be assigned to the taxpayer’s account. (

) After the IRSN is assigned, the taxpayer’s information is stored on the following databases: the Name Search Facility (NSF) and either the Taxpayer Information File (ITIF) or the Business Taxpayer Information File (BTIF). a. The NSF is a database that contains taxpayer name and address and can be accessed using the Command Code NAMEI or NAMES. b. The ITIF and BTIF are databases that contain the taxpayer’s account formation and can be viewed using the taxpayer’s IRSN via Command Code ENMOD. (
) An establishment transaction record (TC
) is produced which is sent to End of Day processing and forwarded to the appropriate Master File. (
) This command code is used to request a formatted TMSSN IMF input (
) TMSSNI must be preceded by either Command Code NAMES or NAMEI to Code TMSSNI determine if the taxpayer already has a valid SSN. Request Formatted Screen (

for TMSSNI Input Format. (

Exhibit 2.4.59-1 (Cont. 1) (01-01-2012) IMF Input Format
Description
TMSSNI

Required ﬁeld.The ﬁrst position must be al- phabetic or numeric. Subsequent positions may be alphabetic, numeric, –, &, ], or blank. The Name Control ﬁeld must also be entered and must match the Name Control indicated on the Primary Name Line.
Exhibit 2.4.59-1 (Cont. 2) (01-01-2012) IMF Input Format
Description
Required ﬁeld.This is either a foreign country, city/state/zip or a Major City Code and Zip Code.
If a foreign country is entered in place of city name, it must be followed by a comma plus a period.
City:City name must be 3 to 22 characters long. Valid characters are alphabetic or blank. The last character of the city name must be a comma, followed immediately by the State Code.

Major City Code— A two character Major City Code valid for the campus of input may be used in place of the City and State. If a Major City Code is used the Zip Code must be input. A Major City Code must be ately followed by two commas (,,).
Required ﬁeld.The year must be less than 1971 or greater than 1981.
Valid values are 01-15 but not 03 or 07. If MFR is 08 the Scrambled SSN Indicator must be 10 or 12.
Exhibit 2.4.59-1 (Cont. 3) (01-01-2012) IMF Input Format
Description
Required If married ﬁling a joint return, and spouse SSN is available.
IMF Response Screen

a. The IRSN is returned to the user. b. The response screen requires the user to enter the three digit C letter number to be sent to the taxpayer. c. Program control is passed to Command Code LPAGE via the LETER Command Code. The user in the appropriate paragraphs.

Exhibit 2.4.59-3 (Cont. 2) (01-01-2013) BMF Input Format
BMF Input Format 5 6 44–78 SORT NAME 6 7 44–78 CARE OF NAME 7 8 44–78 FOREIGN STREET ADDRESS 8 9 44–78 MAIL STREET OR FOREIGN CITY/ZIP 9 10 44–78 MAIL CITY STATE OR FOREIGN COUNTRY

Major City Code— A two character Major City Code valid for the service center of input may be used in place of the City State. If a Major City Code is used the Zip Code must be input. A Major City Code must be immediately followed by two commas (,,).
State— A valid two-character State Code must follow city name and comma. For a foreign address a period plus a blank (.b) must substitute for the State Code. Does not apply if using Major City Code.

Zip Code— Must begin immediately following the space after the State Code or the second comma after a Major City Code. Entry must be ﬁve or nine numeric characters; valid range for the ﬁrst ﬁve characters is
to
, except the fourth and ﬁfth digits must not be
Zip Code may not be input if a foreign address. The Zip Code must be valid for the State Code entered.
